doc.previous: The power consumption of atomic clocks varies with their size Atomic clocks on the scale of one chip require less than 30 milliwatt 19 The United States Time Standard atomic clocks NIST F1 and NIST F2 use far greater quantities of power 12 20
doc.after: Most research focuses on the often conflicting goals of making the clocks smaller cheaper more accurate and more reliable
